On this page

Business Context ​

Scale of Operations ​

The Permissions Seeking operation is substantial in scale:

MetricValue
Total Organization Staff (FTE)60+
Permissions Seeking FTE19
Annual Requests~70,000
Active Projects/Year~6,000
System Record Updates/Year~10,000

Business Drivers ​

Why Permissions Matter ​

  1. Legal Compliance - Unauthorized use of copyrighted content exposes Elsevier to legal liability
  2. Author Relationships - Professional handling of permissions maintains trust with content creators
  3. Publication Quality - Third-party content often provides essential clinical images, research data, and illustrations
  4. Revenue Protection - Properly licensed content ensures publications can be sold without legal encumbrance

Cost Considerations ​

Permission costs vary significantly:

FactorImpact on Cost
Source TypePublishers typically charge more than individual authors
Usage ScopeWorld rights cost more than regional
FormatPrint + Electronic costs more than single format
Commercial UseHigher fees than educational use

Fee Approval Process ​

When fees are quoted, they go through an approval workflow based on amount:

Workflow Volume Distribution ​

By Division ​

DivisionProjects/Year
S&T (Standard)1,480
HS (Health Sciences)770

Tier Categories ​

Health Sciences (HS) Tiers ​

TierDescription
Tier 0Author/CDS obtains all permissions; CS validates and uploads
Tier 4CDS provides permission log; CS obtains permissions
Rule of 10CS performs Rule of 10 assessment only

S&T Tiers (RREF, Hot Topics, MRW) ​

TierDescription
Tier 1Author obtains all permissions and provides log; CS validates
Tier 2Author provides log; CS obtains permissions
Tier 3Author submits manuscript; CS creates log and obtains permissions

Key Performance Indicators ​

Timeliness Target ​

  • Primary KPI: Completion 30 days prior to Files To Printer (FTP) date

Role Definitions ​

AbbreviationFull Name
CDSContent Development Specialist
CSCopyrights Specialist
RPCRights & Permissions Collector

Seasonal Patterns ​

Permission request volumes fluctuate based on:

  1. Publication Cycles - Higher volume before major publication deadlines
  2. Academic Calendar - Textbook updates drive Q2-Q3 spikes
  3. Journal Schedules - Special issues create temporary surges
  4. Year-End - December slowdown due to holidays

Strategic Initiatives ​

Current Focus Areas ​

  1. Automation - Reduce manual effort through AI/ML classification
  2. Self-Service - Enable authors to handle Tier 0/1 cases
  3. Integration - Connect RPC with other Elsevier systems
  4. Analytics - Improve forecasting and resource planning
